body: Any thoughts about introducing `$: path.resolve("./src")` as a default over forcing `$lib` as a de-facto standard? Gives you `$/lib/whatever.js` and `$/anything/you/want.js` with zero config. Seems more flexible than providing an alias to just `$lib`.

I would definitelly not like to write `$src/lib/file` instead `$lib/file`.... and you would still need this "alias" feature, as if you change structure of project, or have multiple nested folders, you would like to configure it anyway.

@furudean We don't want to encourage people to import things like `$src/hooks.js` or `$src/routes/__layout.svelte` â€” that would lead to people putting things in the wrong places just because they can. If something is used in multiple parts of the app, `src/lib` is _where it goes_.

It's also what defines your package, if you're using `svelte-kit package`.

---

Another reason we might want to implement this is that people might use custom aliases in `src/lib`, and at the moment only `$lib` is resolved. We _could_ resolve other aliases based on `config.kit.vite.resolve.alias` or the `tsconfig`, but both of those have drawbacks, so having a single source of truth could be easier.

Then again, I stand by "overusing aliases is problematic", and it's probably good to nudge people towards just using `lib` everywhere.
I use `$lib` everywhere, and actually I find it the best approach... it was enough for me in nearly every case, and I think it's enough for a lot of people in most cases. So I agree with Rich.

body: @Rich-Harris I just raised an issue on the same subject (https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/4774) as this has been an annoyance to several of my projects... There I proposed to use the existing vite aliases, since they are already there, so should be easier to implement. But I think `config.kit.alias` would be a nicer solution. And also without all that `resolve` nonsense.
I wouldn't delete "resolve()" thing, because in case of monorepo, if you want to point to another repo (with some library for example) then without `path.resolve()` it would be problem...

issue.body:
### Describe the problem

Moving https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/2884#issuecomment-1097913960 into its own issue. If a repo contains both an app _and_ a package, it's quite possible for `package.json` to contain dependencies that are only relevant to the app. These get copied into `package/package.json` on `svelte-kit package`.

### Describe the proposed solution

It'd be nice if the generated `package.json` only included the dependencies that were referenced in `lib`.

### Alternatives considered

Give users manual control over the `package.json`. Would make a good all-purpose escape hatch, but is very much a case of forcing the human to do the computer's job.

### Importance

nice to have

_No response_
